title: Will HDFC Bank issue pass-through certificates to local asset managers by August 2024?
body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, HDFC Bank issues pass-through certificates to one or more local asset managers in India. Eligible asset managers include, but are not limited to, ICICI Prudential AMC, Nippon Life India Asset Management, and SBI Funds Management. The issuance must be confirmed through at least one of the following: 1) Official announcements by HDFC Bank, 2) Official statements from the participating asset managers, or 3) Reports from at least two reputable financial news sources (such as Bloomberg, Reuters, Financial Times, or The Economic Times). The total value of the issued pass-through certificates is not relevant for the resolution of this question. If no such issuance occurs by the specified date, or if the issuance cannot be confirmed through the aforementioned sources, the question will resolve as NO.

The sale must be confirmed through official announcements by HDFC Bank or reported by at least two reputable financial news sources (such as Bloomberg, Reuters, Financial Times, or The Economic Times). The use of pass through certificates for this purpose should be explicitly mentioned in these reports. If HDFC Bank does not complete such a sale using pass through certificates by the specified date, or if the total value of loans sold using this method is less than $1 billion, the question resolves as NO.

title: Will India receive above-normal rainfall in September 2024?
body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, official meteorological reports confirm that India is forecast to receive above-normal rainfall in September 2024, which is the last month of the June-September monsoon season. The confirmation must come from reputable sources such as the India Meteorological Department (IMD) or other recognized meteorological authorities. 'Above-normal' rainfall should be clearly defined by the reporting authority, typically as a percentage above the long-term average for September. If no such forecast is made or if the forecast does not indicate above-normal rainfall for September 2024, the question will resolve as NO. Note that this question is about the forecast for September 2024, not the actual rainfall, as the actual data would not be available by the resolution date.

title: Will India's major reservoirs have higher-than-average water levels by August 2024?
body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, official reports from the Central Water Commission of India or other authoritative government bodies indicate that the water levels in India's major reservoirs are higher than the average levels recorded for the same period in previous years. The comparison should be based on data from at least the past five years. The increase in water levels should be attributed to rainfall patterns, not artificial interventions like reduced water usage or increased water diversion. If no such official confirmation is available, or if the water levels are reported as average or below average, the question will resolve as NO. For the purpose of this question, 'major reservoirs' refer to those monitored and reported on by the Central Water Commission in their weekly or monthly bulletins.

body: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, a court issues an order to halt or suspend Massachusetts' initiative targeting crisis pregnancy centers. Specifically address and halt or suspend the initiative, either in part or in whole. 3. The question resolves as NO if: 1. No such court order is issued by August 31, 2024. 2. Any issued court order does not meet all the above criteria. Note: Temporary restraining orders or preliminary injunctions that are quickly overturned do not qualify for a YES resolution unless they remain in effect until August 31, 2024.

body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, SpaceX successfully conducts a commercial spacewalk involving private astronauts (non-government, non-military personnel). The spacewalk must be officially confirmed by SpaceX through their official channels (website, social media, or press releases) or reported by at least two major reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, or Bloomberg). The spacewalk must involve at least one private astronaut exiting a SpaceX spacecraft while in orbit. A successful spacewalk is defined as the planned exit and re-entry of the private astronaut(s) from and to the spacecraft, with the completion of any predetermined objectives for the extravehicular activity. If no such spacewalk occurs or is not confirmed by the specified date, the question will resolve as NO.

The ruling can be to hear the case, decline to hear the case, or any other official decision on the appeal. If no such ruling is issued by August 31, 2024, or if the appeal is withdrawn before a ruling is made, the question will resolve as NO. Note that this question does not depend on the outcome of the ruling, only on whether a ruling is issued within the specified timeframe.

title: Will Walmart complete a major apple juice recall within the next 10 months?
body: This question resolves as YES if Walmart successfully completes a recall of approximately 10,000 cases of apple juice found to contain elevated levels of inorganic arsenic by August 31, 2024. Official confirmation of the recall completion must come from Walmart's public statements or reports from at least two reputable news sources. The recall must involve around 10,000 cases (with a margin of error of ±500 cases) and be related to elevated inorganic arsenic levels in apple juice. If the recall is not completed by the specified date, or if the scale or reason for the recall differs significantly from what's described, the question resolves as NO.

body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA) initiates any form of legal action against Walmart specifically related to the recall of apple juice due to elevated levels of inorganic arsenic. Legal action in this context includes, but is not limited to, filing lawsuits, imposing fines, or initiating formal legal proceedings against Walmart. The question will resolve as NO if no such legal action is initiated by the FDA against Walmart regarding this specific recall by the specified date. Information about any legal action must be verifiable through official FDA statements, court records, or reports from at least two major reputable news sources.

title: Will a federal judge order significant changes to Google's Android app store?
body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, a federal judge in the United States issues an official order mandating substantial changes to Google's Android app store. The changes must be directly related to addressing concerns about Google's market dominance or alleged monopolistic practices in the Android app ecosystem. To qualify, the order must require Google to implement modifications that notably alter the current structure, policies, or operations of its Android app store.

For a YES resolution, the judge's order must be reported by at least two reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, The Wall Street Journal, or The New York Times). The reports should clearly indicate that the changes are a result of legal proceedings related to Google's app store practices.

Examples of significant changes could include, but are not limited to:
- Allowing alternative app stores on Android devices
- Modifying Google's app store revenue sharing model
- Changing app approval processes
- Altering in-app purchase systems

Minor adjustments or temporary measures will not qualify for a YES resolution. If no such order is issued by the specified date, or if any order issued does not meet the criteria for significance as outlined above, the question resolves as NO.

title: Will Arizona hold a referendum on abortion rights by August 2024?
body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Arizona officially holds a statewide referendum on enshrining abortion rights in the state constitution or law. For a YES resolution:

1. The referendum must be officially scheduled and conducted by the Arizona state government.
2. The specific topic of the referendum must be about enshrining or protecting abortion rights.
3. The referendum must be completed, and results must be reported by at least three major, reputable news sources (e.g., Associated Press, Reuters, NPR, major national or local Arizona news outlets).

The question will resolve as NO if:
1. No such referendum is held by August 31, 2024.
2. A scheduled referendum is cancelled or postponed beyond the resolution date.
3. A held referendum does not specifically address enshrining or protecting abortion rights.

Note: The mere scheduling of a referendum without it being held by the resolution date is not sufficient for a YES resolution.

title: Will Israel and Gaza agree to a ceasefire by August 31, 2024?
body:
This question will resolve as YES if a ceasefire agreement between Israel and Gaza is officially announced and confirmed by both parties by August 31, 2024. For the resolution to be positive, the following criteria must be met:

1. The ceasefire agreement must be officially announced by representatives of both Israel and Gaza.
2. The agreement must be reported by at least two internationally recognized news sources (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, Al Jazeera).
3. The ceasefire must be intended to halt all military operations between the two parties for a specified period.

The question will resolve as NO if:
1. No ceasefire agreement is announced by August 31, 2024.

title: Will Maine maintain its three-day waiting period for gun purchases?
body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Maine continues to enforce a mandatory three-day waiting period for gun purchases as part of its state law. For a YES resolution, the following criteria must be met:

1. The three-day waiting period law must remain in effect and be actively enforced by gun retailers across Maine.
2. There should be no successful legal challenges or legislative actions that have nullified or significantly altered the waiting period requirement.
3. Confirmation of the law's continued enforcement must be available through official state government sources or reports from at least two reputable national or local news organizations.

The question will resolve as NO if:
1. The three-day waiting period law has been repealed, suspended, or significantly modified to reduce or eliminate the waiting period.
2. A court ruling has rendered the law unenforceable.
3. There is widespread non-compliance among gun retailers with no state enforcement actions.

In cases of partial enforcement or temporary suspensions, the question will resolve based on the status of the law on August 31, 2024.
